cards.notes: With the Time Guardian dead, the time agents were among the first to discover time travel and created an agency to protect the flow of time from temporal disruptions. For a short time (from their point of view), they ensured the correct flow of time, but it was a losing battle. They failed and technology jumped thousands of years in a day. Most time agents have died or retired somewhere in time, however occasionally you can still encounter time agents from the short time they fought for the fabric of time randomly throughout the timeline.

cards.notes: CW: This might give you anxiety, it comes from that place in me and I've spoilered the first line separate from the rest because the first line and the card will give you a pretty good idea of what this story is. ||You ever think about what the most fucked up way to die is?|| ||I'm not real sure what the answer is, but I know what the circumstances behind that death look like. You've known it was coming, it was creeping ever closer towards you for a long time, maybe hours, maybe days, hell, maybe you've known for years. But you've known it's coming and you know you're gonna die horribly. Being cast adrift in space would be like that. Even if you can see the space station or the ship the whole time, they may not be able to come back for you. Their orbit not not be something they can line up even if you were lucky enough to be in orbit or it may take so long to go around that it may not matter by the time that you and the station reconnect. Will they recover your body? Can they afford to expend the resources to do so? Will you fall into atmosphere or remain adrift, a permanent marker of humanity's follies, like Green Boots on Everest? Will you still be alive when you fall into atmosphere? Is that preferable to suffocating? Do you have a way to cut your suit and go all at once? Do you even want to do that? What if I do that and they come back for me? What will they think of me? What will they think of me if I don't do it, will I be the fool?||
